rules: Rule1: If the artist collective receives funding from the city grant program, then the digital gallery opens the exhibition for public access.
Rule2: The artist collective receives funding from the city grant program or the artist collective receives funding from a corporate sponsor.

Rule3: If the curator approves content featuring traditional artworks, then when the artist collective meets the deadline for the exhibition opening, the digital gallery opens the exhibition for public access.

Rule4: If the curator approves content featuring digital installations, then provided that the artist collective meets the deadline for the exhibition opening, the digital gallery opens the exhibition for public access.

Rule5: If the curator consults with an art historian expert, then when the curator reviews the submission of the artist portfolio, the curator approves content featuring traditional artworks or the curator approves content featuring digital installations.
Rule6: The curator consults with an art historian expert or the curator consults with a technology advisor expert.

Rule7: If the curator consults with a technology advisor expert, then under the condition that the curator reviews the submission of the artist portfolio, the curator approves content featuring traditional artworks or the curator approves content featuring digital installations.
Rule8: If management cancels the exhibition at the digital gallery, then management reschedules the exhibition at the digital gallery.
Rule9: If management cancels the exhibition at the digital gallery, then management does not reschedule the exhibition at the digital gallery.

Rule10: Management cancels the exhibition at the digital gallery or the digital gallery experiences technical failure due to server crash or the digital gallery opens the exhibition for public access.
Rule11: If platform staff conduct training on emergency protocols, then when the digital gallery implements backup with offline mode, the digital gallery launches the platform for the VR exhibition.
Rule12: Platform staff conduct training on emergency protocols or platform staff conduct training on user support.

Rule13: If platform staff conduct training on user support, then provided that the digital gallery implements backup with offline mode, the digital gallery launches the platform for the VR exhibition.
Rule14: If the artist collective submits a portfolio containing mixed media, then the artist collective includes augmented reality in their works.
Rule15: The artist collective submits a portfolio containing mixed media or the artist collective submits a portfolio containing digital-only works.
Rule16: If the artist collective submits a portfolio containing digital-only works, then the curator approves content featuring digital installations.
Rule17: If the artist collective includes traditional pieces in their works, then the curator approves content featuring traditional artworks.
Rule18: If the artist collective includes augmented reality in their works, then the artist collective includes traditional pieces in their works.

Rule19: The artist collective completes documentation for the exhibition proposal or if the artist collective receives funding from a corporate sponsor, then the digital gallery opens the exhibition for public access.
Rule20: If the digital gallery develops the interactive interface feature, then the digital gallery launches the platform for the VR exhibition.
Rule21: If the digital gallery hires a VR specialist developer, then the digital gallery fixes bugs related to performance issues.
Rule22: If the digital gallery tests software using the compatibility suite, then the digital gallery develops the interactive interface feature.
Rule23: If the digital gallery fixes bugs related to performance issues, then the digital gallery tests software using the compatibility suite.
Rule24: If the digital gallery does not open the exhibition for public access, then the digital gallery implements backup with offline mode.
Rule25: If the digital gallery does not open the exhibition for public access, then the digital gallery hires a VR specialist developer.
facts: Fact1: The curator reviews the submission of the artist portfolio.
Fact2: The artist collective meets the deadline for the exhibition opening.
Fact3: The digital gallery does not experience technical failure due to server crash.
Fact4: The artist collective does not complete documentation for the exhibition proposal.
Fact5: The digital gallery does not launch the platform for the VR exhibition.

question: The digital gallery opens the exhibition for public access.
